com.algonquincollege.cst8284.section302.simulation

Class Actor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.algonquincollege.cst8284.section302.simulation.Actor

  • public class Actor
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to create Actors on class SpaceExplorationSimulator and verify their movements. An Actor is defined as either a Ship or an Asteroid
    Since:
    javac 1.8.0_271
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Stanley Pieda, modified by Daniel Pereira Castillo Student number: 041009960 Lab Section 302
    See Also:
    SpaceExplorationSimulator, SpaceProgram

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private char icon
      This variable represent the character which represent the actor A for asteroid or S for ship
      private boolean isMoved
      This variable represents whether or not an actor is moved

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Actor()
      This is the no-argument constructor chained to Actor(char icon) This constructor has no parameters
      Actor(char icon)
      This constructor accepts a char argument and is chained to Actor(char, boolean)
      Actor(char icon, boolean isMoved)
      This constructor accepts char and boolean arguments

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      char getIcon()
      This method accesses the icon created by the class
      boolean isMoved()
      This method verifies whether or not a an actor has moved
      void setIcon(char icon)
      this method changes the icon to represent the appropriate actor, either an asteroid or a ship
      void setMoved(boolean isMoved)
      This method changes the value of isMoved
